FOR DOCUMENTATION PURPOSES ONLY

Base filter is the base element to build special filter comparator fields
Your element is then bindable with type filter.Comparator

 after binding with .. a wire --filternode is triggered

 ### internal hooks
 #### --clear
 Use this to clear the filter val and is.

declarations.description:
`furo-chart-display`
 Component to display charts with apex the apex charts lib (https://github.com/apexcharts/apexcharts.js).

 Use `furo-data-chart-binder` to connect your data.

 ```html
 <furo-chart-display chart-type="bar">
    <furo-data-chart-binder
        ƒ-bind-data="--projectDAO(*.entities)"
        data-field="data.cost_limit.units"
        category-field="data.description"
    ></furo-data-chart-binder>
 </furo-chart-display>
 ```
declarations.name: FuroChartDisplay

members.name: sparkline
members.description:
Hides all elements of the chart other than the primary graphic.
Use this to visualize data in very small areas.

members.name: xaxisTitle
members.description: Give the x-axis a title which will be displayed below the axis labels by default.

members.name: xaxisDatetime
members.description: Set this to true if you have datetime, google.type.date or timestamp data on the x-axis

members.name: zebra
members.description: set zebra color like zebra="#f3f4f5, #fff" to get stripes

members.name: noDataText
members.description:
Set the text to display, if no data is given.

If this option is not set, the default is **No data.**

members.name: legend
members.description: Enables the legend on bottom left with offset 0:0

members.name: dataLabels
members.description: Enable labels with data on every item.

members.name: tooltip
members.description: show a tooltip on mouseover

members.name: legendAlign
members.description:
Aligns the legend to `left` `center` `right`

default is **left**

members.name: legendPosition
members.description:
Set the position of the legend to `top`, `right`, `bottom`, `left`

Default is **bottom**

members.name: legendOffsetX
members.description: Moves the legend in the **x** direction for n pixels from `legend-position`

members.name: legendOffsetY
members.description: Moves the legend in the **y** direction for n pixels from `legend-position`

members.name: toolbar
members.description: Enables the toolbar

members.name: toolbarDownload
members.description: Enables the download option in the toolbar (svg,csv,png)

members.name: plotHorizontal
members.description: Enable this to draw the bars horizontally

members.name: grid
members.description: Draw the horizontal grid lines

members.name: chartType
members.description:
line, area, bar are mixable

radar, scatter, heatmap

pie donut polarArea radialBar can only consume 1 data series

members.name: stacked
members.description:
WORK IN PROGRESS
Stacked bar charts are not mixable

members.description:
Aligns the title. Possible values are 'left', 'center', 'right'

Default is **left**

members.name: titleOffsetX
members.description: Moves the title for n pixels on the x-axis from the alignment direction

members.name: titleOffsetY
members.description: Moves the title for n pixels on the y-axis from the alignment direction

members.name: fixedHeight
members.description: Set a fixed height for the plot. Default is auto, this can be useful if you need to control the heights

declarations.description:
`furo-data-chart-binder`
 Connects data objects (repeaterNodes) with the charting lib.

 Use multiple binders if you need more then one series per chart.

 ```html
 <furo-chart-display chart-type="bar">
    <furo-data-chart-binder
        ƒ-bind-data="--projectDAO(*.entities)"
        data-field="data.cost_limit.units"
        category-field="data.description"
    ></furo-data-chart-binder>
 </furo-chart-display>
 ```
declarations.name: FuroDataChartBinder

dataField
members.description:
Define the data field or fields here. For most charts this is **the y axis**.

Some charts requires more then one data field (i.e. bubbles want at least 3 fields `data-field="data.start.day, data.end.day, data.start.day"` ).

members.name: categoryField
members.description: Define the category field here (only 1 field). You can think of this as it is the x axis for your chart.

members.name: chartType
members.description:
**Use this for mixed charts scenarios only**, prefer to define the chart-type on the chart-display.
Specify the default type on the display and set the custom type on this binder.

declarations.description:
`furo-data-context-menu`
 A  [material design](https://material.io/components/menus/) context menu or menu element.

 You have to put a `furo-data-context-menu-display` element in one of the parent elements of the element where you use the `furo-data-context-menu`.
 The app-shell is a good place for that.

```html
 <furo-data-context-menu condensed position="below" ƒ-trigger="--menuClkd" ƒ-bind-data="--menuObject" @-menu-item-selected="--menuItem">
     <furo-icon-button icon="menu" @-click="--menuClkd"></furo-icon-button>
 </furo-data-context-menu>
```
declarations.name: FuroDataContextMenu

declarations.description:
INITIAL VERSION

`furo-data-filter-slot`
 Throw in any component to use it as a filter

 The component must emit a **value-changed** event with the value you want to have in the condition

 The component can emit a **clear** event to clear the filter

 The values of the component are not updated from this component. You have to do an additional binding by yourself if needed.
 Do not forget that the condition value always comes as a string, when binding to your component.
declarations.name: FuroDataFilterSlot

slots.description: default slot to add a filter component (must emit a **value-changed** event).

declarations.description:
`furo-type-renderer`
The furo-type-renderer is used to display type specific data. It uses **display** as default context and will warn you
on the console if the requested `context-[type-name]` does not exist or was not imported.

There is a standard set of display components @furo/ui5/src/standard-type-renderers for rendering the individual types.

The standard ui5 set can be integrated with the import
- import '@furo/ui5/src/standard-type-renderers/display-registry.js'.

The standard material set can be integrated with the import
- import '@furo/data-ui/src/standard-type-renderers/display-registry.js'.

If you want to implement an individual display of a type, you need your own `context-[type-name]` component and import it.

for repeated fields you should write your own context-[type-name]-repeated component and import it.
If no context-[type-name]-repeated exists, the renderer will use the display-[type] component as fallback and
display it repeatedly, this is ok for a lot of cases.

## Naming convention

```
display-google-type-timeofday
------- ---------------------
   |             |
context      type-name

# examples:
cell-string
celledit-string
display-string
yourcontext-string

The method to evaluate the renderer is built as following:

context-[(package.type).replaceAll('.', '-').toLocaleLowerCase()]
```



## Basic Usage
```
  <furo-type-renderer ƒ-bind-data="--dao(*.data.fieldname)"></furo-type-renderer>
```

## Writing your own renderer
The only API you need to implement in your component is the `bindData()` method.
You just have to follow the naming convention for your renderer.
declarations.name: FuroTypeRenderer

members.name: bindData
members.description:
Evaluates the component name
Special treatment for google.protobuf.Any

members.name: _createDisplay
members.description: Creates the component for single fields

members.name: _createRepeatedDisplay
members.description:
Creates the component for repeated fields
Component naming: [package-type]-repeated

Fallback: if no -repeated component is available, a flow-repeat is used...

members.name: _addElement
members.description:
Attribute handling
Adding to DOM

Set the context if you need another then display.
Prebuilt context renderers exist for display, cell, celledit.
